## Why I left Jekyll

-   no global search
-   not the best workflow for technical writing; code output is a pain

old workflow:

-   

themes - presentation of blog posts is minimalistic but the title doesn't stand out - the tag system is not structured the way I want

![](quarto_logo.png){width="350"}

## Hello, Quarto

-   Technical writing - handle Python and R

-   

-   the directory hierachy is different, thus rename files in batch is needed

-   fix broken link by creating \_redirect

improve workflow

-   live preview of the site

2.  rename index.md


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
old.names <- list.files(path = ".", pattern = "md$", recursive = TRUE)
old.names
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "index.qmd"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
new.names <- old.names
new.names
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
[1] "index.qmd"
```
:::

```{.r .cell-code}
new.names <- gsub(
  pattern = "^(.*)$",
  replacement = "index.qmd",
  x = old.names)

new.names <- file.path(dirname(old.names), new.names)

file.rename(old.names, new.names)
```
